intro: Erysimum taraxacifolium, commonly known as the dandelion leaf wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves that resemble those of a dandelion. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in early spring, which are borne on slender, branching stems. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Erysimum taraxacifolium is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards.
